author: Kevin Truong
title: Cruise admits lying to feds about dragging woman in San Francisco
text: A little more than a year after a Cruise robotaxi dragged a woman in San Francisco, the company dodged a criminal charge by admitting that it misled federal regulators about what happened. Authorities accused Cruise of impeding an investigation into the crash by failing to provide a description or video of the dragging in a meeting with federal transportation officials the morning after the crash. A report submitted later that day also omitted the dragging. The General Motors-owned company has agreed to pay a $500,000 fine and accept responsibility for the criminal charges laid out by the U.S. Justice Department. Cruise is also required to cooperate with government investigations, implement a safety compliance program, and provide annual reports on that progress. The deferred prosecution deal comes about a month and a half after Cruise was hit with a $1.5 million fine by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. The pedestrian-dragging incident that touched off the regulatory and criminal probes took place in October 2023, when a woman was thrown in the path of a Cruise vehicle on Market Street in downtown San Francisco. The robotaxi halted, but its sensor system failed to detect that there was a person beneath it, so it wound up dragging the woman more than 20 feet as it pulled over to the side of the road. Under federal regulations, Cruise was required to report such crashes to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. Although Cruise later provided the video to NHTSA officials, the company failed to correct the incident report in a timely manner. “Federal laws and regulations are in place to protect public safety on our roads,” Martha Boersch, the U.S. Attorney’s Criminal Division chief, said in a news release Thursday. “Companies with self-driving cars that seek to share our roads and crosswalks must be fully truthful in their reports to their regulators.” The dragging incident threw a wrench in Cruise’s expansion plans and led to its once-ubiquitous fleet of robotaxis with cutesy names getting pulled from streets nationwide. Federal and state officials also launched investigations into the company and how it met disclosure requirements in the wake of the crash. In June, a California Public Utilities Commission judge approved a separate $112,500 settlement to end the agency’s probe into the dragging. Several top executives — including founder and CEO Kyle Vogt — resigned or were fired in the aftermath of the crash, and Cruise cut hundreds of jobs as it scaled back. In September, Cruise announced it would soon return to the Bay Area with mapping vehicles in Sunnyvale and Mountain View — but that each car would have a driver behind the wheel. Cruise President Craig Glidden said the company will adhere to the deferred prosecution agreement as it moves forward under new leadership “and with a firm commitment to transparency with our regulators.”

author: Erick Almanza
title: Despenalización del aborto en Puebla avanza; colectivas se muestran optimistas
text: Con mayoría de [Morena ](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/nacional/2024/07/10/por-que-citlalli-hernandez-se-bajo-de-la-competencia-en-morena-esto-dijo/)y aliados de la 4T, Puebla se perfila para convertirse en la entidad 14 en despenalizar el aborto. Este viernes 12 de julio las Comisiones de Procuración de Justicia y de Salud sesionarán para analizar el tema que fue pospuesto a lo largo de los últimos años. El presidente de la Junta de Gobierno y Conciliación Política del Congreso del estado, Edgar Garmendia de los Santos, indicó que este viernes se hará la sesión correspondiente para pasar el punto al pleno la próxima semana. Destacó que se ha escuchado la voz de colectivos y diversos grupos de mujeres para tomar una decisión. Se perfila que el punto finalmente sea aprobado por mayoría relativa, pues existe un consenso para que los aliados de Morena respalden la despenalización de la [ interrupción del embarazo](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/estados/2024/04/25/jalisco-despenaliza-el-aborto-tribunal-declara-inconstitucional-su-prohibicion-tras-amparo/). De igual forma, la bancada de Acción Nacional mantiene su negativa a respaldar este tema. ¿Cuáles son los temas que se discutirán sobre el aborto en Puebla? La diputada del PT, Mónica Silva Ruiz, expuso que se tienen tres iniciativas para abordar el tema, una a la Constitución para eliminar el concepto de la vida desde la concepción, otra al sector salud a fin de que se brindara el servicio y en el tema del Código Penal a fin de que no tuviera una pena privativa de la libertad las mujeres que hicieran esta intervención Consideró que será un tema pendiente las modificaciones a la Ley de Salud, para que cualquier clínica pudiese ofrecer el servicio, y modificar la Constitución Política del Estado, para eliminar que la vida humana debe ser protegida desde el momento de la concepción, como se estipula en el artículo 26. No obstante, se busca eliminar las penas en los primeros tres meses de embarazo. De esta forma cualquiera que abortase después de las 12 semanas de gestación, podría ir a la cárcel hasta por un periodo de un año. Al que hiciese abortar a una mujer con su consentimiento después de ese periodo, se le aplicará de uno a tres años de prisión. Además, cometerá el delito de aborto forzado, aquel que interrumpa el embarazo sin consentimiento y se sancionará con cuatro a ocho años de prisión, así que aumentaría porque la legislación actual lo pena hasta con tres años. De igual forma, las causales para no sancionar el aborto sufrirían algunas modificaciones y quedarían de la siguiente forma: cuando el embarazo sea resultado de una violación o una inseminación artificial no consentida; cuando la mujer corra peligro de muerte, cuando a juicio de un especialista exista razón suficiente para que el producto tenga alteraciones genéticas o congénitas y cuando sea causado solo por imprudencia de la mujer o persona gestante. Los colectivos feministas se muestran optimistas con que el asunto finalmente sea aprobado. Zavine Magadán Pérez, de REDefine Puebla, manifestó que desde que inicio de la legislatura en 2021 las colectivas se han encargado de realizar un trabajo de cabildeo y acercamiento con los 41 diputados. Por su parte, Cinthya Ramírez, de la Campaña por el Aborto Legal [Puebla](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/tags/puebla/), indicó que el abordar nuevamente la legalización del aborto es un compromiso que tiene el poder legislativo con los derechos de las mujeres y personas con capacidad de gestar en la entidad.

author: @24tvua
title: Завод Резонит атаковали ВСУ - чем занимается этот объект ВПК под Москвой - 24 Канал
text:
Операция была осуществлена с целью снижения возможностей России по изготовлению высокотехнологичного вооружения и техники. Об этом сообщает 24 Канал со ссылкой на Генштаб.
Смотрите также Под ударом Тамбов и аэродром "Бутурлиновка": Силы обороны поразили важные объекты врага
Чем занимается "Резонит"
Организовали атаку на "Резонит" подразделения Сил беспилотных систем во взаимодействии с другими составляющими Сил обороны.
Этот завод занимается серийным производством и монтажом печатных плат и производством электроники.
Его продукцию россияне активно используют при изготовлении высокотехнологичного вооружения и техники.
Сейчас результаты огневого поражения "Резонита" уточняются.
"Силы обороны продолжают принимать все меры, чтобы подорвать военно-экономический потенциал российских оккупантов и заставить Россию прекратить вооруженную агрессию против Украины", – добавили в Генштабе.
Напомним, что из-за атаки на Московскую область местные власти даже вводили ограничения на посадку и взлет самолетов в аэропортах "Внуково" и "Шереметьево". Российская "певео" ночью также работала в Подольске (Подмосковье), Курске, Белгороде и Брянске.

author: @speedwaydigest
title: Ankrum Prepares to Finish Off Career-Best Season at Phoenix
text: On to Phoenix … Tyler Ankrum has reached the NASCAR CRAFTSMAN Truck Series (NCTS) season finale at Phoenix Raceway to finish off a career best season. The driver of the No. 18 LIUNA Chevrolet Silverado RST was just short of making the Championship round after his impressive run from the tail to eighth-place at Martinsville Speedway last Friday. In his first season with the MHR organization, Ankrum has posted his career high in top-five’s, top-10’s, laps led, and average finish. Heading into Phoenix, Ankrum is ranked eighth in the drivers’ point standings. Playoff Run… In his third career NCTS playoff run, Ankrum gave it his all, earning four top-10 finishes and one top-five result through six races. He advanced to the Round of 8 with strong performances, including top-10 finishes at The Milwaukee Mile and Bristol Motor Speedway. Despite a 14th-place finish at Talladega Superspeedway, Ankrum rebounded with a top-five at Homestead-Miami Speedway, entering Martinsville Speedway 41 points away from the cutoff. After starting from the rear of the field, the San Bernardino, Calif. native charged through the field, gaining 26 positions to finish in eighth. 2024 Season Stats… In his sixth full-time NCTS season and first with MHR, Ankrum delivered a standout performance, achieving career highs in multiple categories. He recorded 12 top-10 finishes, six top-five finishes, and two stage wins, along with a career-best average finish of 12.5. Ankrum also led the points standings for the first four events for the first time in his NCTS career. Over the course of the year, he scored 30 or more points in 13 races. His best finish came at Las Vegas Motor Speedway where he earned a strong runner-up result. Tune In …The 2024 season finale for the NCTS will kick off practice on Thursday evening. Television coverage beings Friday afternoon with qualifying at 4:00 p.m. ET on FOX Sports 2. The final green flag of the year will wave at 8:00 p.m. ET on FOX Sports 1. Stay connected with the No. 18 LIUNA team by following @BMR_NASCAR on Twitter, @bmrnascar on Instagram, and Bill McAnally Racing on Facebook. Tyler Ankrum Quote: On The Season Finale at Phoenix: “It’s a little bittersweet to not be competing for a championship this weekend. This No. 18 LIUNA team has given me a great truck all season long. This week we will go out and give everything we have to show what we are capable of. Though we aren’t battling for the title we are going to go enjoy ourselves and try to get into victory lane and finish the season off with a statement.” MHR PR [see all](https://speedwaydigest.com/index.php/author/speedwaydigeststaff/)) [Toyota Racing – NCTS Championship 4 Media Day – Corey Heim – 11.07.24](https://speedwaydigest.com/index.php/news/nascar-truck-series-news/319128-toyota-racing-ncts-championship-4-media-day-corey-heim-11-07-24/)- November 7, 2024[NASCAR Championship Weekend Media Day (Ty Majeski & Cole Custer)](https://speedwaydigest.com/index.php/news/xfinity-series-news/319125-nascar-championship-weekend-media-day-ty-majeski-cole-custer/)- November 7, 2024[AM Racing to Field ARCA Menards Series West Entry for Kole Raz at Phoenix Raceway](https://speedwaydigest.com/index.php/news/racing-news/319110-am-racing-to-field-arca-menards-series-west-entry-for-kole-raz-at-phoenix-raceway/)- November 7, 2024
